text: When trying to perfom a deploy operation with a file fileName##versionNum as specified in the Tomcat7 parallel deployment info, Ant is not able to find the correct file. Everything works fine when doing a simple deploy (file without the ## caracters).
creator: mgeich5+apachebug@gmail.com
bodewig@apache.org
text: I think you are talking about a task that is part of the Tomcat distribution and not part of Ant itself.  You better report this with the Tomcat community as I doubt anybody here will know how to help.

Do you prefix the name of the file with file: ? if it is prefixed by file: then it is a URL. Maybe in this case the ## needs to be escaped as %23%23 . The # character is nothing special in XML but could well be special in URLs.

I saw the sources of this deployment task here :

http://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/tomcat/tc7.0.x/trunk/java/org/apache/catalina/ant/DeployTask.java

You can also reassign the bug report to Tomcat 7 which is also in Bugzilla.
creator: antoine@apache.org

text: Hi guys, thanks for the help. I am using "file:" and with %23%23 it worked, ant finds the file. Now the problem is that I can't deploy a specific version. This option does not seems to be in the task. I will now try to find a solution for this.
creator: mgeich5+apachebug@gmail.com
